title: Add omnix flake-module
body:
This provides a replacement for the `nix-health` flake-module.

Example usage: https://github.com/srid/haskell-template/pull/139

title: doc: Init with mdbook
body:
Also build in CI and deploy to github pages.

#178

title: nix: Create `./crates/*/crate.nix`
body:
Use the new upstream `rust-flake`, consequently, using https://github.com/juspay/rust-flake/pull/21

Also, add `pkgs.nix-flake-schemas` to overlay, thus decoupling the handling nix fork to nixpkgs.nix module.

title: nix_rs: Refactor to isolate qualified_attr volatility
`om ci`: Allow `om.ci` configuration
body:
Refactor the surrounding code to deal with qualified attr flake config, with the consequent fixes in `om health`.

The final PR that resolves #151

title: `om init`: Faster registry loading using JSON cache
body:
Precache the registry flake output in JSON file, so we don't have to evaluate all of the Nix (which can grow exponentially as we add more inputs, with their own nested inputs).

Will refactor the flakreate module organization in later PR.

title: ci: Pin CLI and nix-health on cachix
body:
So they don't get GC'ed

https://docs.cachix.org/pins

title: Avoid unnecessary rebuilds of Nix package
body:
When irrelevant files, like `./nix/closure-size.nix`, change - the `.#omnix-cli` package is being unnecessarily rebuilt. 

This PR fixes that. The update to rust-flake is not relevant, but the subsequent commit is.

title: cli: Static executable on Linux
body:
#149 

```sh
❯ nix build
❯ ldd ./result/bin/om
        statically linked
```

title: Always use 11.0 framework on Intel Mac
body: Consistently use the 11.0 framework for all packages on Intel mac.

title: fix: Intel build and add to CI
body: omnix should build on intel-mac (x86_64-darwin) and can be added to ci as well.

title: Port nixci integration test to omnix-cli tests
Fix `-v` to work as expected
body: Resolves #180

title: Add `om ci`
body:
Let's include nixci (as `om ci`) in our #140 

This PR includes #181

title: Import nixci
body: Let's get `om ci` working as part of MVP and nixpkgs release.

title: nix_rs: Add static data for `NixCmd`, `NixConfig`, `NixInfo`
body:
Basically, provide a singleton creator for these structs. 

Change other crates to use this, instead of managing their own static variable.

(When we move nixci over here, we'll do the same for nixci.)

title: cli: add shell completion
body: Resolves #56

title: `om init`: Flesh out CLI test
body:
Basic tests for now.

With `inquire` we have no choice but to use the `rexpect` crate; see https://github.com/mikaelmello/inquire/issues/71#issuecomment-1977138491

title: `om init`: Use `om.templates` for non-standard config
body: Template config is still in this repo. Will upstream them soon.

title: Link `om init` to `flakreate`
body:
`om init` will now run flakreate.

Make flakreate a library.

Add CLI test stub (not used)

title: `flakreate`: Import templates locally and use them
body:
Import https://github.com/flake-parts/templates locally and use it.

It doesn't make sense to use upstream since we are going to use `flake.om.templates` configuration.

title: Import `flakreate` repo
body:
Import https://github.com/juspay/flakreate into `./crates/flakreate`, and upgrade to use the newer `nix_rs`.

https://github.com/juspay/flakreate/issues/4

title: Use flake-schemas
body:
This PR enforces `nix flake show` to use `nix` compiled from https://github.com/DeterminateSystems/nix-src/tree/flake-schemas by default (see https://github.com/NixOS/nix/pull/8892). This allows defining a custom schema of the user's choice, with the default set to https://github.com/DeterminateSystems/flake-schemas. 

TODO:
- [x] ~~Wrap `om` with `nix-flake-schemas` script~~ Allow overriding the `nix` with flake-schemas via `NIX_FLAKE_SCHEMAS_BIN` env
- [x] Use flake-schemas in `omnix-gui`
- [x] parse type of flake output from flake-schemas
- [x] `nix_rs` ChangeLog

resolves #161

title: Fix doc warnings, and check them in CI
body: The `-doc` package will now fail build if there are warnings in Rust docs: https://github.com/juspay/rust-flake/pull/18

title: Add CLI integration tests
body:
Instead of testing the CLI in bash, test them the Rust way.

cf. 

- [Test Organization > Integration Tests](https://doc.rust-lang.org/book/ch11-03-test-organization.html#integration-tests)
- [Testing CLI applications by running them](https://rust-cli.github.io/book/tutorial/testing.html#testing-cli-applications-by-running-them)

Note that these tests are not run during Nix build due to sandboxing issues (`NixEnv` detection fails), so we run them separately in CI.

title: health: Recognize `om.health` from flake.nix
body:
In addition to `nix-health.default`, `om health` will now also recognize `om.health.default`.

Down the line, we may as well deprecate and remove `nix-health.default`.

#153

title: feat: Statically link libiconv on `aarch64-darwin`; Test static binary in CI
body:
Note: macOS system libraries will not be statically linked

resolves #149 

## Before
```sh
❯ otool -L ./result/bin/om
./result/bin/om:
        /System/Library/Frameworks/SystemConfiguration.framework/Versions/A/SystemConfiguration (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1109.60.2)
        /System/Library/Frameworks/Security.framework/Versions/A/Security (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 59754.60.13)
        /System/Library/Frameworks/IOKit.framework/Versions/A/IOKit (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 275.0.0)
        /System/Library/Frameworks/CoreFoundation.framework/Versions/A/CoreFoundation (compatibility version 150.0.0, current version 1770.255.0)
        /nix/store/0rsh55ighfv3fxidf3xz8vl3abiika0i-libiconv-99/lib/libiconv.2.dylib (compatibility version 7.0.0, current version 7.0.0)
        /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1292.60.1)
```

## After
```sh
❯ otool -L ./result/bin/om
./result/bin/om:
        /System/Library/Frameworks/SystemConfiguration.framework/Versions/A/SystemConfiguration (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1109.60.2)
        /System/Library/Frameworks/Security.framework/Versions/A/Security (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 59754.60.13)
        /System/Library/Frameworks/IOKit.framework/Versions/A/IOKit (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 275.0.0)
        /System/Library/Frameworks/CoreFoundation.framework/Versions/A/CoreFoundation (compatibility version 150.0.0, current version 1770.255.0)
        /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1292.60.1)
```

In `After`, `libiconv` is statically linked.

TODO:
- [x] Use libiconv static on darwin, after https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/pull/322497 reaches `nixpkgs-unstable` (Also see: https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues/320448#issuecomment-2213814702)
- [x] https://github.com/juspay/omnix/pull/158#issuecomment-2233484730
~~- [ ] Consider how #166 will impact this.~~ (see https://github.com/juspay/omnix/pull/158#issuecomment-2244086640)

title: omnix-cli: `om show` init
body: resolves #147

title: Initialize logging
body:
- Setup bare logging (like `nix_health` does)
- Use `clap_verbosity_flag` crate https://github.com/clap-rs/clap-verbosity-flag for `-v` and `-q`
- Fix a double `NixEnv` evaluation on `nix_health`
- cli: Setup `human-panic`

title: health: Initialize `om health`
body: Runs nix-health, but doesn't configure logging yet.

title: `nix_rs`/`nix_health`: Import from separate repo
body:
- Import `nix_rs` from https://github.com/juspay/nix-rs
- Import `nix_health` from https://github.com/juspay/nix-health

Let's keep them in this mono repo for ease of development alongside omnix.

We will potentially eventually move `nixci` into this repo as well (before #151).

body: Introduces `clap` crate, and stubs out `init` and `show` commands for #140

body: The `omnix` crate will be shared between the CLI and GUI crates.

title: Initialize `omnix-cli` crate
body:
Add `./crates/omnix-cli` (hello world) for building the CLI on top of. Build using `nix build .#omnix-cli`

For Nix support, this involved doing https://github.com/juspay/rust-flake/pull/11

In addition:

- make home icon clickable on other routes than `Dashboard` only
- Includes 02b4c30 from  #139

title: build(deps): bump mio from 0.8.9 to 0.8.11

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [mio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/mio) from 0.8.9 to 0.8.11.
Changelog

Sourced from mio's changelog.

0.8.11

  • Fix receiving IOCP events after deregistering a Windows named pipe (tokio-rs/mio#1760, backport pr: tokio-rs/mio#1761).

0.8.10

Added

  • Solaris support (tokio-rs/mio#1724).
Commits
  • 0328bde Release v0.8.11
  • 7084498 Fix warnings
  • 90d4fe0 named-pipes: fix receiving IOCP events after deregister
  • c710a30 Add v0.8.x to the CI
  • c29e21c Release v0.8.10
  • f6a20da Add Solaris operating system support (#1724)
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=mio&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.8.9&new-version=0.8.11)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. body:
It is not reproducible, 

https://twitter.com/sridca/status/1747848107973542385

title: Make `nix-health` trusted-users check recognize groups and all-users
body: Resolves #104

title: Cache retrieved flakes on disk
body:
Flakes are fetched once and cached on disk, so as to persist across app restarts. To refetch, the user can hit the 'refresh' button.

- [x] dioxus-std storage deserialization issues https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus-std/pull/17#pullrequestreview-1719137114
- [ ] trim cache size?
- [ ] refactor build_network logic

title: Persist `Signal` state to disk (recently visited flakes now persist)
body:
For #96 by leveraging https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus-std/pull/17

- [x] "Recent flakes" should work
- [x] Add a default list of flakes (if recent flakes is empty)

title: Task aware `Datum`s
body:
The `Datum` type now keeps track of the loader/refresh tokio task (its `AbortHandle` specifically), so that we can cancel a previously-running refresh before doing a new one.

This refactors a change made in the #93 PR (which which change, the app will panic if the user tries to load two flakes in quick succession).

title: Compile tailwind automatically as part of `just watch` (or `nix build/run`)
body:
Consequently, get rid of the generated CSS file from the git repo.

Uses https://github.com/srid/dioxus-desktop-template/pull/10 - which adjusts nativeBuildInputs to make tailwindcss available to the cargo build.

title: Simplify and consolidate `NixEnv` & `NixInfo` types
body: Keeping them together makes it simpler to deal with them in the UI

title: Build `Signal`s as a network
body: Not super happy with this change. Signals seem more trouble that worth. Will evaluate the use of simple `use_state` next.

title: Simplify health check trait & types
body:
This PR vastly simplifies things.

Needed for juspay/omnix#63 as well as to make juspay/omnix#58 optional.

Now, the check types represent the check *configuration* - rather than the check *result*.  Consequently, we are also able to get rid of all the per-check leptos views (in future, `check.info` would use Markdown via juspay/nix-health#30).

e2e playwright test

title: Use workspace to decouple library crates
body:
The `nix` module should live in a crate of its own without coupling with leptos.

- Create `crates/nix_rs` containing nix command types & functions (no UI code)
- Create `crates/nix_health` for health checks (no UI code)
- Create `crates/leptos_extras` containing extra leptos library functions
- Move all leptos UI code out of nix modules, and put them under app module, thus decoupling UI entirely. All UI now lives under `./src/app`.
- Also update cargo deps

<details>
<summary>tasks</summary>

- [x] Initial working version
- Decoupling
  - [x] Decouple `command.rs`? or just `ServerFnError`
  - [x] Decouple `view!` impls?
    - Consider upcoming CLI view as well
    - An idea: create `app/*.rs` for each segment and put the server fns and view impls there.
- [ ] Review tracing logging in library (use parent `nix_rs` span everywhere?)
  - [x] Fix logs missing from project crates
- [x] Make `src/leptos_extra` its own crate
- [x] Use workspace common dependencies
</details>

title: using available port if default is bound
body: Used `try_bind` instead of `bind` which will panic if port is busy, and case matching on it. In Error case, i am updating port by adding 1 and retrying for port.
